00146 int nfs3_Access( nfs_arg_t               * parg,    
00147                  exportlist_t            * pexport, 
00148                  fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext,   
00149                  cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00150                  hash_table_t            * ht,
00151                  struct svc_req          * preq,    
00152                  nfs_res_t               * pres )   
00153 {
00154         static char       __attribute__(( __unused__ ))        funcName[] = "nfs3_Access";
00155 
00156   fsal_accessflags_t        access_mode ;
00157   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
00158   cache_inode_file_type_t   filetype ;
00159   cache_entry_t           * pentry = NULL ;
00160   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   fsal_data  ;
00161   fsal_attrib_list_t        attr ;
00162  
00163    /* Is this a xattr FH ? */
00164    if( nfs3_Is_Fh_Xattr( &(parg->arg_access3.object) ) )
00165      return nfs3_Access_Xattr( parg, 
00166                                pexport, 
00167                                pcontext,
00168                                pclient,
00169                                ht,
00170                                preq,
00171                                pres ) ;
00172 
00173    /* to avoid setting it on each error case */
00174    pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resfail.obj_attributes.attributes_follow = FALSE;
00175 
00176    /* Convert file handle into a fsal_handle */
00177    if( nfs3_FhandleToFSAL( &(parg->arg_access3.object), &fsal_data.handle, pcontext ) == 0  )
00178         return NFS_REQ_DROP;
00179 
00180   /* Get cache_inode related entry, but looking up at it */
00181   fsal_data.cookie = DIR_START ;
00182 
00183   /* Get the entry in the cache_inode */
00184   if( ( pentry = cache_inode_get( &fsal_data, 
00185                                   &attr, 
00186                                   ht, 
00187                                   pclient, 
00188                                   pcontext, 
00189                                   &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
00190     {
00191       if( nfs_RetryableError(cache_status) )
00192        {
00193           return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00194        }
00195       else
00196        {
00197           pres->res_access3.status = nfs3_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00198           return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00199        }
00200     }
00201   
00202   /* Get file type */
00203   filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ;
00204   
00205 
00206   access_mode = 0;
00207   
00208   if( parg->arg_access3.access & ACCESS3_READ )
00209     access_mode |= FSAL_R_OK ;
00210   
00211         if( parg->arg_access3.access &
00212             (ACCESS3_MODIFY | ACCESS3_EXTEND) )
00213     access_mode |= FSAL_W_OK ;
00214   
00215         if( filetype == REGULAR_FILE )
00216     {
00217       if (parg->arg_access3.access & ACCESS3_EXECUTE)
00218         access_mode |= FSAL_X_OK;
00219     }
00220   else if( parg->arg_access3.access & ACCESS3_LOOKUP )
00221     access_mode |= X_OK;
00222 
00223   
00224   /* Perform the 'access' call */
00225  if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00226                           access_mode, 
00227                           ht, 
00228                           pclient, 
00229                           pcontext, 
00230                           &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00231     {
00232       /* In Unix, delete permission only applies to directories */
00233       
00234       if ( filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || filetype == DIR_CONTINUE )
00235         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access = parg->arg_access3.access;
00236       else
00237         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access = (parg->arg_access3.access & ~ACCESS3_DELETE);
00238       
00239       /* Build Post Op Attributes */
00240       nfs_SetPostOpAttr( pcontext,
00241                          pexport,
00242                          pentry,
00243                          &attr,
00244                          &(pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.obj_attributes));
00245       
00246       pres->res_access3.status = NFS3_OK;
00247       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00248     }
00249         
00250   if( cache_status == CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EACCESS )
00251     {
00252       /*
00253        * We have to determine which access bits are good one by one 
00254        */
00255       pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access = 0;
00256       
00257       if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00258                               FSAL_R_OK,
00259                               ht, 
00260                               pclient, 
00261                               pcontext, 
00262                               &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00263         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= ACCESS3_READ;
00264       
00265       if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00266                               FSAL_W_OK,
00267                               ht, 
00268                               pclient, 
00269                               pcontext, 
00270                               &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00271         pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= (ACCESS3_MODIFY | ACCESS3_EXTEND) ;
00272       
00273       if( filetype == REGULAR_FILE )
00274         {
00275           if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00276                                   FSAL_X_OK,
00277                                   ht, 
00278                                   pclient, 
00279                                   pcontext, 
00280                                   &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00281             pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= ACCESS3_EXECUTE;
00282         } 
00283       else
00284         {
00285           if( cache_inode_access( pentry, 
00286                                   FSAL_X_OK,
00287                                   ht, 
00288                                   pclient, 
00289                                   pcontext, 
00290                                   &cache_status ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00291             pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resok.access |= ACCESS3_LOOKUP;
00292         }
00293       
00294       pres->res_access3.status = NFS3_OK;
00295       return NFS_REQ_OK ;
00296     }
00297   
00298         /* If we are here, there was an error */
00299         if( nfs_RetryableError(cache_status) )
00300     {
00301       return NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00302     }
00303   
00304         nfs_SetFailedStatus( pcontext, pexport,
00305                        NFS_V3,
00306                        cache_status,
00307                        NULL,
00308                        &pres->res_access3.status,
00309                        pentry,
00310                        &(pres->res_access3.ACCESS3res_u.resfail.obj_attributes),
00311                        NULL, NULL, NULL,
00312                        NULL, NULL, NULL);
00313         return NFS_REQ_OK;
00314 
00315 } /* nfs3_Access */
00316 
00325 void nfs3_Access_Free( nfs_res_t * pres )
00326 {
00327   /* Nothing to do */
00328   return ;
00329 } /* nfs3_Access_Free */
